item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Blessings be on this house," Granny said, perfunctorily. It was always a good opening remark for a witch. It concentrated people's minds on what other things might be on this house." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There isn't a way things should be. There's just what happens, and what we do." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Using a metaphor in front of a man as unimaginative as Ridcully was like a red flag to a bu... was like putting something very annoying in front of someone who was annoyed by it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "What's a philosopher?' said Brutha. Someone who's bright enough to find a job with no heavy lifting,' said a voice in his head." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The presence of those seeking the truth is infinitely to be preferred to the presence of those who think they've found it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Mike add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Mike add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mike add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mike add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mike add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mike add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Mike add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mike add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mike add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Mike add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mike add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Mike add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Mike Reeves-McMillan
item.description: "The wrong thing being?” asks Halwaz. “Closing up their source, of course,” you say, in a tone which implies, “Did you think I was merely talking about their sacrificing small fuzzy animals in an attempt to bring back ancient evil gods?" -- Mike Reeves-McMillan

item.title: Mike add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mike add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "There is no immortality that is not built on friendship and work done with care. All the secrets in the world worth knowing are hiding in plain sight." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Mike add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "After that, the book will fade, the way all books fade in your mind. But I hope you will remember this: A man walking fast down a dark lonely street. Quick steps and hard breathing, all wonder and need. A bell above a door and the tinkle it makes. A clerk and a ladder and warm golden light, and then: the right book exactly, at exactly the right time." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Mike add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Walking the stacks in a library, dragging your fingers across the spines -- it's hard not to feel the presence of sleeping spirits." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Mike add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Neel takes a sharp breath and I know exactly what it means. It means: I have waited my whole life to walk through a secret passage built into a bookshelf." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Mike add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Your life must be an open city, with all sorts of ways to wander in." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Mike add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Kat bought a New York Times but couldn’t figure out how to operate it, so now she’s fiddling with her phone." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Mike add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "He has the strangest expression on his face- the emotional equivalent of 404 PAGE NOT FOUND." -- Robin Sloan
